title: Understanding SQL Clauses
text: In SQL, a clause is a part of a query that performs a specific function. Common clauses include SELECT, FROM, WHERE, and ORDER BY.

title: Identifying Clauses in a Query
text: To identify the number of clauses in a SQL statement, look for keywords that define different parts of the query, such as SELECT, FROM, WHERE, and ORDER BY.

title: Counting Clauses
text: How many distinct clauses can you identify in the statement: SELECT Height,Weight FROM Shapes WHERE $$Material='wood'$$ ORDER BY Height?
